The provided Node.js code dynamically loads and exports a version of the React Router DOM library based on the current Node.js environment. If the environment variable `NODE_ENV` is set to "production", it will load the minified production build of React Router DOM. Otherwise, it will load the development version. This approach is commonly used to facilitate debugging in development while optimizing performance in production.

```javascript
'use strict';

const environment = process.env.NODE_ENV;
const isProduction = environment === "production";

const productionModule = "./umd/react-router-dom.production.min.js";
const developmentModule = "./umd/react-router-dom.development.js";

const moduleToExport = isProduction ? productionModule : developmentModule;

module.exports = require(moduleToExport);
```
